What Do we notice?
There is a huge difference between the amount of coaches who are POC compared to players. This amount doesn't surprise us as often times racial equality in positions of power such as a coach are a lot harder to achieve compared to others.

What do we wonder?
What is the specific reasoning for their being less Coaches of colour compared to the players?

What impact does this have on the community?

It gives us statistics that we can use to push for more equality in sports.

What is going on in the graph?

All sports have drastic differences between coaches of colour and players of colour the biggest difference being in the NFL where there is 61 percentage points more players of colours compared to the coaches.

Catchy Title?

We have diversity on the field but is there on the sideline?
